>>Consider the following transition graph of a discrete Markov chain with four states.

If the system is in state 4 at time n, what is the probability it will be in state 4 at time n + 4 (Please round to 3 decimals) Hint: You have to solve for \(P_{41}\)? << = 0.32 +- 5% [explanation] Method 1: Method 2: Sum probabilities of all possible paths. A path is denoted in the following format: \(Stage_{n+1}-Stage_{n+2}-Stage_{n+3}-Stage_{n+4}\) 4-4-4-4 (system takes self-loop every single time): \(0.6^4 = 0.1296\) 4-3-2-4: \(0.6*0.4*0.4*0.5 = 0.048\) 3-3-2-4: \(0.4*0.6*0.4*0.5 = 0.048\) 3-1-1-4: \(0.4*0.4*0.3*0.5 = 0.024\) 3-1-4-4: \(0.4*0.4*0.5*0.6) = 0.048\) 3-1-2-4: \(0.4*0.4*0.2*0.7 = 0.0224\) Sum: \(0.1296 + 0.048 + 0.048 + 0.024 + 0.048 + 0.0224 = 0.32\) [explanation]
